awd_titl_txt: Quantum Dynamics in Clusters and at Surfaces
awd_abstract_narration: In this project in the Theoretical and Computational Program of                 the Chemistry Division, Professor Whaley will study two highly                  significant and difficult problems.  The study of liquid helium                 clusters is expected to provide important new insights                          regarding the possibility of superfluidity in condensed phases.                 The investigation of gas-surface interactions will lead to                      fundamental understanding of catalysis.                                                                                                                         The excited states and dynamics of quantum liquid clusters of                   He will be investigated with a quantum liquid drop model,                       combined with quantum Monte Carlo calculations.  A new                          technique is proposed for quantum scattering from continua of                   coupled channels and will be applied to inelastic atomic and                    molecular scattering from solid surfaces and scattering from                    disordered surfaces.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
